column4: hello..... i have a problem... ive used the tar Flash player and apt-get Flash player for Firefox and everytime flash player uploads a file, it kills firefox..... i was told to perform a fresh install of firefox but that doesnt work...... please help me =(
use a fresh profile
what does that mean?
run firefox -profilemanager from cli and add a new profile
that just launched firefox
that's firefox -ProfileManager
how will this help my problem
in theory yes, but it's slow and unreliable and i'd never do it without a bckup
i just need some more space for Ubuntu... my Windows partitions already fucked... its just where i store my crappy crap at
you need not necesarily resize partitons... you could separate /home or /var .... gazillions of ways to add space to a Linux system transparently
how would he install that if he cant move his mouse?
does he have an external USB mouse at hand? usually these work, even if the internal touchpad doesnt
he said he could borrow one from his grandmas
he said his caps lock was blinking on and off too
that's a kernel panic.... so the mouse is the last of his problems then
he said it kept doing that
i dont know which one he should use
that depends... he should first run a boot into single mode (without bootsplash) and see which errors scroll by dfuring the verbose boot process on the console
so hit the control alt f1 while usplash is up?
simply 'esc' and 'cursor down' to chose the single mode from grubs menu. boot splash is automatically disabled for theis mode
oh
